messages.content: What is the purpose of the comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes?
The comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes provide detailed segmentation of faces in images using a face parsing model and a yolov8 face model.
Which face parsing model is used in the comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes?
The face parsing model used in the comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes is from the jonathandinu/face-parsing repository on Hugging Face.
What is the purpose of using the yolov8 face model in the comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes?
The yolov8 face model is used to first extract faces from an image to improve face segmentation accuracy in the comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes.
What is provided for skin smoothing in the comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes?
A guided filter is provided for skin smoothing in the comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes.
How can users install the comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes?
Users can install the comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes by cloning the repo https://github.com/Ryuukeisyou/comfyui_face_parsing.git into ComfyUI's 'custom_nodes' directory.
What files need to be downloaded for the face parsing model and yolov8 face model?

Users need to download the .json and .safetensors files from the face parsing model repo and save them to the 'models/face_parsing/' folder, and download the face_yolov8m.pt file from the Bingsu/adetailer repo and save it to the 'models/ultralytics/bbox' folder.
What is the purpose of the opencv-contrib-python requirement?
The opencv-contrib-python requirement is needed for the guided filter in the comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes.
What is shown in the demo workflow image?
The demo workflow image shows an example of how the comfyui_face_parsing custom nodes can be used to process an image, with the original and processed images compared side by side.
